name: GetBack GPS
tagline: Open Source Android app for finding your way back to a previously visited location using GPS coordinates.
body: Imagine visiting a town, going to an event or doing some hiking. When finished, you have to find your car again, or the way to the station, or any other point where you started. Store a location when you start your trip, and at the end of the day, use the app to find your way back to where you started. ## Screenshots More [screenshots](wiki/Screenshots). ## Features * determine location based on GPS signal, WiFi or cell phone network : * use best/most accurate location provider * get location updates automatically (based on a time interval or change of location) or * get location on demand (by manually refreshing) * save a location * ‘get back’ mode : indicator pointing to a stored location (showing distance and direction) * indicate current speed and current bearing ## How to get it? Development started in december 2012 and is still ongoing. If you can't wait to try it out, you can get the code from the [git repository](https://github.com/ruleant/getback_gps) and [build the current development version](wiki/Development) yourself. ## Bugs and feature requests Please report bugs and add feature requests in the [issue tracker](https://github.com/ruleant/getback_gps/issues). Requests for translations to a new language can be made here as well. ## Translation You can [help translating](http://hosted.weblate.org/projects/getback_gps/strings) the app to your own language. [![Translation status](http://hosted.weblate.org/widgets/getback_gps-287x66-grey.png)](http://hosted.weblate.org/engage/getback_gps/?utm_source=widget) Is your language not listed? Follow the instructions on the 'New language' tab on weblate or open an issue in the github [issue tracker](https://github.com/ruleant/getback_gps/issues). ## Credits and acknowledgements This app was made possible by : see [Credits](wiki/Credits). ## Contact Find us on Google+ and [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/getbackgps).
